page.title: 05Alyn Valley Wildlife (1)
page.content: In this area a number of differing habitats are represented and so a great variety of wildlife is found. On the moorland of the Clwydian Hills birds such as meadow pipits,grouse and kestrels may be seen. The coniferous plantations provide a home for gold- crests and crossbills and are a refuge for foxes. The hedgerows in the valley are of benefit to nesting birds, while the hedge-banks support a wealth of wild flowers and also provide homes for mice, voles and shrews. The woods, being on limestone, support a rich flora, including a number of species of wild orchids. Birds and animals found here include woodpeckers, owls, tree-creepers,grey squirrels, badgers, grass-snakes, adders and lizards. The River Alyn supports fish and a varied invertebrate fauna, and birds such as grey wagtails and dippers are common.
